parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: A continuation token from a previous file iterator.

methods.name: continueFileIterator(continuationToken)
methods.description:
Resumes a file iteration using a continuation token from a previous iterator. This method is
useful if processing an iterator in one execution exceeds the maximum execution time.
Continuation tokens are generally valid for one week.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: A continuation token from a previous folder iterator.

methods.name: continueFolderIterator(continuationToken)
methods.description:
Resumes a folder iteration using a continuation token from a previous iterator. This method is
useful if processing an iterator in one execution exceeds the maximum execution time.
Continuation tokens are generally valid for one week.

parameters.name: blob
parameters.description: The data for the new file.

methods.name: createFile(blob)
methods.description: Creates a file in the root of the user's Drive from a givenBlobof arbitrary data.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the new file.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content for the new file.

methods.name: createFile(name, content)
methods.description:
Creates a text file in the root of the user's Drive with the given name and contents. Throws an
exception ifcontentis larger than 50 MB.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the new file.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content for the new file.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: The MIME type of the new file.

methods.name: createFile(name, content, mimeType)
methods.description:
Creates a file in the root of the user's Drive with the given name, contents, and MIME type. Throws
an exception ifcontentis larger than 10MB.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the new folder.

methods.name: createFolder(name)
methods.description: Creates a folder in the root of the user's Drive with the given name.

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The file ID of the target file or folder.

methods.name: createShortcut(targetId)
methods.description: Creates a shortcut to the provided Drive item ID, and returns it.

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The ID of the target file or folder.

parameters.name: targetResourceKey
parameters.description: The resource key of the target file or folder.

methods.name: createShortcutForTargetIdAndResourceKey(targetId, targetResourceKey)
methods.description:
Creates a shortcut to the provided Drive item ID and resource key, and returns it. A resource
key is an additional parameter that needs to be passed to access the target file or folder that
has been shared using a link.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new state of the enforceSingleParent flag.

methods.name: enforceSingleParent(value)
methods.description: Enables or disables enforceSingleParent behavior for all calls affecting item parents.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

methods.name: getFileById(id)
methods.description:
Gets the file with the given ID. Throws a scripting exception if the file does not exist or the
user does not have permission to access it.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: resourceKey
parameters.description: The resource key of the folder.

methods.name: getFileByIdAndResourceKey(id, resourceKey)
methods.description:
Gets the file with the given ID and resource key. Resource keys are an additional parameter
which need to be passed to access files that have been shared using a link.

methods.name: getFiles()
methods.description: Gets a collection of all files in the user's Drive.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the files to find.

methods.name: getFilesByName(name)
methods.description: Gets a collection of all files in the user's Drive that have the given name.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: The MIME type of the files to find.

methods.name: getFilesByType(mimeType)
methods.description: Gets a collection of all files in the user's Drive that have the given MIME type.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder.

methods.name: getFolderById(id)
methods.description:
Gets the folder with the given ID. Throws a scripting exception if the folder does not exist or
the user does not have permission to access it.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder.

parameters.name: resourceKey
parameters.description: The resource key of the folder.

methods.name: getFolderByIdAndResourceKey(id, resourceKey)
methods.description:
Gets the folder with the given ID and resource key. Resource keys are an additional parameter
which need to be passed to access folders that have been shared using a link.

methods.name: getFolders()
methods.description: Gets a collection of all folders in the user's Drive.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the folders to find.

methods.name: getFoldersByName(name)
methods.description: Gets a collection of all folders in the user's Drive that have the given name.

methods.name: getRootFolder()
methods.description: Gets the folder at the root of the user's Drive.

methods.name: getStorageLimit()
methods.description: Gets the number of bytes the user is allowed to store in Drive.

methods.name: getStorageUsed()
methods.description: Gets the number of bytes the user is currently storing in Drive.

methods.name: getTrashedFiles()
methods.description: Gets a collection of all the files in the trash of the user's Drive.

methods.name: getTrashedFolders()
methods.description: Gets a collection of all the folders in the trash of the user's Drive.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: The search criteria, as detailed in theGoogle Drive SDK documentation.

methods.name: searchFiles(params)
methods.description:
Gets a collection of all files in the user's Drive that match the given search
criteria. The search criteria are detailed in theGoogle Drive SDK documentation. Note that the Drive
service uses v2 of the Drive API and some query fields differ from v3. Review thefield
differences between v2 and v3.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: The search criteria, as detailed in theGoogle Drive SDK documentation.

methods.name: searchFolders(params)
methods.description:
Gets a collection of all folders in the user's Drive that match the given search
criteria. The search criteria are detailed in theGoogle Drive SDK documentation. Note that the Drive
service uses v2 of the Drive API and some query fields differ from v3. Review thefield
differences between v2 and v3.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child file to add.

methods.name: addFile(child)
methods.description: Deprecated.Instead, useFile.moveTo(destination)orFolder.createShortcut(targetId).

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child folder to add.

methods.name: addFolder(child)
methods.description: Deprecated.Instead, useFolder.moveTo(destination)orFolder.createShortcut(targetId).

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child file to remove.

methods.name: removeFile(child)
methods.description: Deprecated.Instead, useFile.moveTo(destination).

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child folder to remove.

methods.name: removeFolder(child)
methods.description: Deprecated.Instead, useFolder.moveTo(destination).

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address of the user to add.

methods.name: addCommenter(emailAddress)
methods.description:
Add the given user to the list of commenters for theFile. If the user was
already on the list of viewers, this method promotes the user out of the list of viewers.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A representation of the user to add.

methods.name: addCommenter(user)
methods.description:
Add the given user to the list of commenters for theFile. If the user was
already on the list of viewers, this method promotes the user out of the list of viewers.

parameters.name: emailAddresses
parameters.description: An array of email addresses of the users to add.

methods.name: addCommenters(emailAddresses)
methods.description:
Add the given array of users to the list of commenters for theFile. If any
of the users were already on the list of viewers, this method promotes them out of the list of
viewers.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address of the user to add.

methods.name: addEditor(emailAddress)
methods.description:
Adds the given user to the list of editors for theFile. If the user was already
on the list of viewers, this method promotes the user out of the list of viewers.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A representation of the user to add.

methods.name: addEditor(user)
methods.description:
Adds the given user to the list of editors for theFile. If the user was already
on the list of viewers, this method promotes the user out of the list of viewers.

parameters.name: emailAddresses
parameters.description: An array of email addresses of the users to add.

methods.name: addEditors(emailAddresses)
methods.description:
Adds the given array of users to the list of editors for theFile. If any of the
users were already on the list of viewers, this method promotes them out of the list of
viewers.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address of the user to add.

methods.name: addViewer(emailAddress)
methods.description:
Adds the given user to the list of viewers for theFile. If the user was already
on the list of editors, this method has no effect.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A representation of the user to add.

methods.name: addViewer(user)
methods.description:
Adds the given user to the list of viewers for theFile. If the user was already
on the list of editors, this method has no effect.

parameters.name: emailAddresses
parameters.description: An array of email addresses of the users to add.

methods.name: addViewers(emailAddresses)
methods.description:
Adds the given array of users to the list of viewers for theFile. If any of the
users were already on the list of editors, this method has no effect for them.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description:
The email address of the user whose permissions should be checked. Google Groups
    aren't supported.

methods.name: getAccess(email)
methods.description:
Gets the permission granted to a specific user. The method doesn't support returning
permissions for a Google Group or permissions inherited through Google Groups.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A representation of the user whose permissions should be checked.

methods.name: getAccess(user)
methods.description:
Gets the permission granted to a specific user. The method doesn't support returning
permissions for a Google Group or permissions inherited through Google Groups.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The MIME type to convert to. For most blobs,'application/pdf'is
    the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of'image/bmp','image/gif','image/jpeg', or'image/png'are also
    valid. For a Google Docs document,'text/markdown'is also valid.

methods.name: getAs(contentType)
methods.description:
Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type. This
method adds the appropriate extension to the filename—for example, "myfile.pdf". However, it
assumes that the part of the filename that follows the last period (if any) is an existing
extension that should be replaced. Consequently, "ShoppingList.12.25.2014" becomes
"ShoppingList.12.25.pdf".

methods.name: getBlob()
methods.description: Return the data inside this object as a blob.

methods.name: getDateCreated()
methods.description: Gets the date theFilewas created.

methods.name: getDescription()
methods.description: Gets the description for theFile.

methods.name: getDownloadUrl()
methods.description:
Gets the URL that can be used to download the file. Only users with permission to open the file
in Google Drive can access the URL. You can use this URL in a browser to download the file, but
you can't use to fetch the file withUrlFetchApp. If you want the contents of the
file in the script, usegetBlob().

methods.name: getEditors()
methods.description:
Gets the list of editors for thisFile. If the user who executes the script
does not have edit access to theFile, this method returns an empty array.

methods.name: getId()
methods.description: Gets the ID of theFile.

methods.name: getLastUpdated()
methods.description: Gets the date theFilewas last updated.

methods.name: getMimeType()
methods.description: Gets the MIME type of the file.

methods.name: getName()
methods.description: Gets the name of theFile.

methods.name: getOwner()
methods.description: Gets the file owner.

methods.name: getParents()
methods.description: Gets a collection of folders that are immediate parents of theFile.

methods.name: getResourceKey()
methods.description:
Gets the resource key of theFilethat is required to access items that
have been shared using a link.

methods.name: getSecurityUpdateEligible()
methods.description:
Gets whether thisFileis eligible to apply the security update that
requires a resource key for access when it's shared using a link.

methods.name: getSecurityUpdateEnabled()
methods.description:
Gets whether thisFilerequires a resource key for access when it's
shared using a link. This requirement is turned on by default for eligible files and folders.
To turn the resource key requirement on or off for eligible files, usesetSecurityUpdateEnabled.

methods.name: getSharingAccess()
methods.description:
Gets which class of users can access theFile, besides any individual
users who have been explicitly given access.

methods.name: getSharingPermission()
methods.description:
Gets the permission granted to those users who can access theFile,
besides any individual users who have been explicitly given access.

methods.name: getSize()
methods.description:
Gets the number of bytes used to store theFilein Drive. Note that
Google Workspace application files do not count toward Drive storage limits and thus return0bytes.

methods.name: getTargetId()
methods.description: If this is a Shortcut, returns the ID of the item it points to.

methods.name: getTargetMimeType()
methods.description: If this is a Shortcut, returns the mime type of the item it points to.

methods.name: getTargetResourceKey()
methods.description:
If the file is a shortcut, returns the resource key of the item it points to. A resource key is
an additional parameter that you need to pass to access files that have been shared using a
link.

methods.name: getThumbnail()
methods.description: Gets a thumbnail image for the file, ornullif no thumbnail exists.

methods.name: getUrl()
methods.description:
Gets the URL that can be used to open theFilein a Google App like
Drive or Docs.

methods.name: getViewers()
methods.description:
Gets the list of viewers and commenters for thisFile. If the user who
executes the script does not have edit access to theFile, this method
returns an empty array.

methods.name: isShareableByEditors()
methods.description:
Determines whether users with edit permissions to theFileare allowed to
share with other users or change the permissions.

methods.name: isStarred()
methods.description: Determines whether theFilehas been starred in the user's Drive.

methods.name: isTrashed()
methods.description: Determines whether theFileis in the trash of the user's Drive.

methods.name: makeCopy()
methods.description: Creates a copy of the file.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The directory to copy the file into.

methods.name: makeCopy(destination)
methods.description: Creates a copy of the file in the destination directory.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The filename that should be applied to the new copy.

methods.name: makeCopy(name)
methods.description: Creates a copy of the file and names it with the name provided.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The filename that should be applied to the new copy.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The directory to copy the file into.

methods.name: makeCopy(name, destination)
methods.description: Creates a copy of the file in the destination directory and names it with the name provided.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The folder that becomes the new parent.

methods.name: moveTo(destination)
methods.description: Moves this item to the provided destination folder.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address of the user to remove.

methods.name: removeCommenter(emailAddress)
methods.description:
Removes the given user from the list of commenters for theFile. This method
does not block users from access theFileif they belong to a class of users
who have general access — for example, if theFileis shared with the user's
entire domain.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A representation of the user to remove.

methods.name: removeCommenter(user)
methods.description:
Removes the given user from the list of commenters for theFile. This method
does not block users from access theFileif they belong to a class of users
who have general access — for example, if theFileis shared with the user's
entire domain.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address of the user to remove.

methods.name: removeEditor(emailAddress)
methods.description:
Removes the given user from the list of editors for theFile. This method doesn't
block users from accessing theFileif they belong to a class of users who have
general access—for example, if theFileis shared with the user's entire
domain, or if theFileis in a shared drive that the user can access.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A representation of the user to remove.

methods.name: removeEditor(user)
methods.description:
Removes the given user from the list of editors for theFile. This method doesn't
block users from accessing theFileif they belong to a class of users who have
general access—for example, if theFileis shared with the user's entire
domain, or if theFileis in a shared drive that the user can access.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address of the user to remove.

methods.name: removeViewer(emailAddress)
methods.description:
Removes the given user from the list of viewers and commenters for theFile. This
method has no effect if the user is an editor, not a viewer or commenter. This method also
doesn't block users from accessing theFileif they belong to a class of users who
have general access—for example, if theFileis shared with the user's
entire domain, or if theFileis in a shared drive that the user can access.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A representation of the user to remove.

methods.name: removeViewer(user)
methods.description:
Removes the given user from the list of viewers and commenters for theFile. This
method has no effect if the user is an editor, not a viewer. This method also doesn't block
users from accessing theFileif they belong to a class of users who have general
access—for example, if theFileis shared with the user's entire domain, or
if theFileis in a shared drive that the user can access.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address of the user whose access should be revoked.

methods.name: revokePermissions(emailAddress)
methods.description:
Revokes the access to theFilegranted to the given user. This method doesn't
block users from accessing theFileif they belong to a class of users who
have general access — for example, if theFileis shared with the user's
entire domain.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A representation of the user whose access should be revoked.

methods.name: revokePermissions(user)
methods.description:
Revokes the access to theFilegranted to the given user. This method doesn't
block users from accessing theFileif they belong to a class of users who
have general access — for example, if theFileis shared with the user's
entire domain.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The new content for the file.

methods.name: setContent(content)
methods.description: Overwrites the content of the file with a given replacement. Throws an exception ifcontentis larger than 10MB.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: the new description for theFile

methods.name: setDescription(description)
methods.description: Sets the description for theFile.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the new name of theFile

methods.name: setName(name)
methods.description: Sets the name of theFile.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: the email address of the user who should become the new owner

methods.name: setOwner(emailAddress)
methods.description:
Changes the owner of theFile. This method also gives the previous owner
explicit edit access to theFile.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: a representation of the user who should become the new owner

methods.name: setOwner(user)
methods.description:
Changes the owner of theFile. This method also gives the previous owner
explicit edit access to theFile.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether to enable the resource key requirement for theFile.

methods.name: setSecurityUpdateEnabled(enabled)
methods.description:
Sets whether theFilerequires a resource key for access when it's
shared using a link. Eligible files and folders are enabled by default.

parameters.name: shareable
parameters.description:
trueif users with edit permissions should be allowed to share with
    other users or change the permissions;falseif not

methods.name: setShareableByEditors(shareable)
methods.description:
Sets whether users with edit permissions to theFileare allowed to share
with other users or change the permissions. The default for a newFileistrue.

parameters.name: accessType
parameters.description: which class of users should be able to access theFile

parameters.name: permissionType
parameters.description: the permissions that should be granted to users who can access theFile

methods.name: setSharing(accessType, permissionType)
methods.description:
Sets which class of users can access theFileand what permissions
those users are granted, besides any individual users who have been explicitly given access.

parameters.name: starred
parameters.description:
trueif theFileshould be starred in the user's
    Drive;falseif not

methods.name: setStarred(starred)
methods.description:
Sets whether theFileis starred in the user's Drive. The default for
newFiles isfalse.

parameters.name: trashed
parameters.description:
trueif theFileshould be moved to the trash of
    the user's Drive;falseif not

methods.name: setTrashed(trashed)
methods.description:
Sets whether theFileis in the trash of the user's Drive. Only the
owner may trash theFile. The default for newFiles isfalse.

methods.name: getContinuationToken()
methods.description:
Gets a token that can be used to resume this iteration at a later time. This method is useful
if processing an iterator in one execution would exceed the maximum execution time.
Continuation tokens are generally valid for one week.

methods.name: hasNext()
methods.description: Determines whether callingnext()will return an item.

methods.name: next()
methods.description:
Gets the next item in the collection of files or folders. Throws an exception if no items
remain.

Gets the list of viewers and commenters for thisFolder. If the user who
executes the script does not have edit access to theFolder, this method
returns an empty array.

methods.name: isShareableByEditors()
methods.description:
Determines whether users with edit permissions to theFolderare allowed to
share with other users or change the permissions.

methods.name: isStarred()
methods.description: Determines whether theFolderhas been starred in the user's Drive.

methods.name: isTrashed()
methods.description: Determines whether theFolderis in the trash of the user's Drive.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The folder that becomes the new parent.

methods.name: moveTo(destination)
methods.description: Moves this item to the provided destination folder.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address of the user to remove.

methods.name: removeEditor(emailAddress)
methods.description:
Removes the given user from the list of editors for theFolder. This method doesn't
block users from accessing theFolderif they belong to a class of users who have
general access—for example, if theFolderis shared with the user's entire
domain, or if theFolderis in a shared drive that the user can access.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A representation of the user to remove.

methods.name: removeEditor(user)
methods.description:
Removes the given user from the list of editors for theFolder. This method doesn't
block users from accessing theFolderif they belong to a class of users who have
general access—for example, if theFolderis shared with the user's entire
domain, or if theFolderis in a shared drive that the user can access.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address of the user to remove.

methods.name: removeViewer(emailAddress)
methods.description:
Removes the given user from the list of viewers and commenters for theFolder. This
method has no effect if the user is an editor, not a viewer or commenter. This method also
doesn't block users from accessing theFolderif they belong to a class of users who
have general access—for example, if theFolderis shared with the user's
entire domain, or if theFolderis in a shared drive that the user can access.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A representation of the user to remove.

methods.name: removeViewer(user)
methods.description:
Removes the given user from the list of viewers and commenters for theFolder. This
method has no effect if the user is an editor, not a viewer. This method also doesn't block
users from accessing theFolderif they belong to a class of users who have general
access—for example, if theFolderis shared with the user's entire domain, or
if theFolderis in a shared drive that the user can access.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address of the user whose access should be revoked.

methods.name: revokePermissions(emailAddress)
methods.description:
Revokes the access to theFoldergranted to the given user. This method doesn't
block users from accessing theFolderif they belong to a class of users who
have general access — for example, if theFolderis shared with the user's
entire domain.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A representation of the user whose access should be revoked.

methods.name: revokePermissions(user)
methods.description:
Revokes the access to theFoldergranted to the given user. This method doesn't
block users from accessing theFolderif they belong to a class of users who
have general access — for example, if theFolderis shared with the user's
entire domain.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: The search criteria, as detailed in theGoogle Drive SDK documentation.

methods.name: searchFiles(params)
methods.description:
Gets a collection of all files that are children of the current folder and match the given search
criteria. The search criteria are detailed in theGoogle Drive SDK documentation. Note that the Drive
service uses v2 of the Drive API and some query fields differ from v3. Review thefield
differences between v2 and v3.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: The search criteria, as detailed in theGoogle Drive SDK documentation.

methods.name: searchFolders(params)
methods.description:
Gets a collection of all folders that are children of the current folder and match the given search
criteria. The search criteria are detailed in theGoogle Drive SDK documentation. Note that the Drive
service uses v2 of the Drive API and some query fields differ from v3. Review thefield
differences between v2 and v3.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: the new description for theFolder

methods.name: setDescription(description)
methods.description: Sets the description for theFolder.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the new name of theFolder

methods.name: setName(name)
methods.description: Sets the name of theFolder.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: the email address of the user who should become the new owner

methods.name: setOwner(emailAddress)
methods.description:
Changes the owner of theFolder. This method also gives the previous owner
explicit edit access to theFolder.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: a representation of the user who should become the new owner

methods.name: setOwner(user)
methods.description:
Changes the owner of theFolder. This method also gives the previous owner
explicit edit access to theFolder.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether to enable the resource key requirement for theFolder.

methods.name: setSecurityUpdateEnabled(enabled)
methods.description:
Sets whether theFolderrequires a resource key for access when it's
shared using a link. Eligible files and folders are enabled by default.

parameters.name: shareable
parameters.description:
trueif users with edit permissions should be allowed to share with
    other users or change the permissions;falseif not

methods.name: setShareableByEditors(shareable)
methods.description:
Sets whether users with edit permissions to theFolderare allowed to share
with other users or change the permissions. The default for a newFolderistrue.

parameters.name: accessType
parameters.description: which class of users should be able to access theFolder

parameters.name: permissionType
parameters.description: the permissions that should be granted to users who can access theFolder

methods.name: setSharing(accessType, permissionType)
methods.description:
Sets which class of users can access theFolderand what permissions
those users are granted, besides any individual users who have been explicitly given access.

parameters.name: starred
parameters.description:
trueif theFoldershould be starred in the user's
    Drive;falseif not

methods.name: setStarred(starred)
methods.description:
Sets whether theFolderis starred in the user's Drive. The default for
newFolders isfalse.

parameters.name: trashed
parameters.description:
trueif theFoldershould be moved to the trash of
    the user's Drive;falseif not

methods.name: setTrashed(trashed)
methods.description:
Sets whether theFolderis in the trash of the user's Drive. Only the
owner may trash theFolder. The default for newFolders isfalse.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child file to add.

methods.name: addFile(child)
methods.description: Deprecated.Instead, useFile.moveTo(destination)orcreateShortcut(targetId).

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child folder to add.

methods.name: addFolder(child)
methods.description: Deprecated.Instead, usemoveTo(destination)orcreateShortcut(targetId).

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child file to remove.

methods.name: removeFile(child)
methods.description: Deprecated.Instead, useFile.moveTo(destination).

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child folder to remove.

methods.name: removeFolder(child)
methods.description: Deprecated.Instead, usemoveTo(destination).

methods.name: getContinuationToken()
methods.description:
Gets a token that can be used to resume this iteration at a later time. This method is useful
if processing an iterator in one execution would exceed the maximum execution time.
Continuation tokens are generally valid for one week.

methods.name: hasNext()
methods.description: Determines whether callingnext()will return an item.

methods.name: next()
methods.description:
Gets the next item in the collection of files or folders. Throws an exception if no items
remain.

methods.name: getDomain()
methods.description: Gets the domain name associated with the user's account.

methods.name: getEmail()
methods.description:
Gets the user's email address. The user's email address is only available if the user has
chosen to share the address from the Google+ account settings page, or if the user belongs to
the same domain as the user running the script and the domain administrator has allowed all
users within the domain to see other users' email addresses.

methods.name: getName()
methods.description: Gets the user's name. This method returnsnullif the user's name is not available.

methods.name: getPhotoUrl()
methods.description:
Gets the URL for the user's photo. This method returnsnullif the user's photo is not
available.

methods.name: getUserLoginId()
methods.description: Deprecated.As of June 24, 2013, replaced bygetEmail().
